title: UAE Defense Company Edge Group Unveils 11 New UAVs and Munitions Systems at Dubai Airshow
originSummary: The UAE defense company EDGE Group showcased 11 new unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and munitions systems at the Dubai Airshow.

One of the notable systems unveiled is the REACH-M unmanned aircraft, which can fly for 24 hours and is specifically designed for ground threats and intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance missions.
EDGE Group also secured contracts to supply MANSUP anti-ship systems to the Brazilian navy and the UAE Ministry of Defence, with deals worth approximately $163 million and $300 million, respectively.

title: Airbus U.S. Space and Defense Launches New Military Drone Business Line
originSummary: Airbus U.S. Space and Defense has established a new business line dedicated to military drones, focusing on optimizing and deploying unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) for the U.S. Department of Defense.
The team includes industry drone operators, military veterans, former defense engineers, and stratospheric aviation experts.
Airbus U.S. Space and Defense aims to contribute to the Department of Defense's efforts to enhance its drone capabilities, but the specific types of UAVs to be developed are not yet known.

title: Designing Maritime Campaigns: Overcoming the Challenges of Integrating Unmanned Systems
originSummary: The article explores the integration of unmanned systems, like drones and unmanned surface vessels, in naval campaigns for deterrence and strategic purposes.
The author emphasizes the necessity of understanding and carefully considering the limitations of these systems.
Active participation, improved intelligence for indications and warnings, and cost-effective solutions are identified as crucial factors in this integration.

title: Airbus U.S. Space & Defense Launches New UAS Business Line to Address Threat of Unmanned Systems
originSummary: Airbus U.S. Space & Defense has created a new division focused on Uncrewed Aircraft Systems (UAS) to combat the rising threat of unmanned systems.
The UAS team, led by a former U.S. Army Aviator, comprises industry professionals and military veterans with expertise in UAS operations and engineering.

The team aims to optimize and expand UAS solutions to meet the increasing demand from the Department of Defense (DoD), using the Zephyr stratospheric platform as the base UAS program. The goal is to provide affordable deep sensing and network extension capabilities to address UAS challenges and enhance the DoD's ability to deter threats.

title: Introducing KHRONOS: A Tethered Drone System Built for Challenging Environments
originSummary: Elistair has introduced KHRONOS, an automated tethered drone system for ISR missions in challenging environments.
The 66-pound drone is easily deployable and offers continuous aerial surveillance for 24 hours within a 10-kilometer radius.
KHRONOS operates in GPS/GNSS-denied and RF-denied environments, and it is ruggedized for off-road and inclement weather conditions. Available in January 2024.

title: Elistair Launches KHRONOS: A Tethered Drone System for ISR Missions
originSummary: Elistair has launched a new tethered drone system known as KHRONOS, specifically designed for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) missions.
The system is fully automated, can be deployed rapidly, and is suitable for challenging environments where GPS and RF signals are unavailable.

KHRONOS provides a continuous aerial view within a 10-kilometer radius for up to 24 hours and can be integrated with vehicles, offering advanced features like target tracking and automated object categorization. The first KHRONOS systems will be delivered to customers in January 2024.

title: AeroVironment's JUMP 20 UAS Demonstrates Adaptability and Modularity at Arcane Thunder 23 Multi-Domain Exercise
originSummary: AeroVironment showcased the adaptability of their JUMP 20 Group 3 unmanned aircraft system (UAS) during the Arcane Thunder 23 exercise.
The UAS was equipped with Electronic Warfare (EW) payloads, allowing it to deliver real-time data and support multi-domain operations.

The successful demonstration highlighted the JUMP 20's capability to meet the evolving requirements of modern warfighters, and AeroVironment's commitment to integrating new technologies into the platform.

title: ALDOT Utilizes SimActive Software for Efficient Tornado Damage Assessment
originSummary: The Alabama Department of Transportation (ALDOT) used SimActive's Correlator3D software to analyze drone imagery for assessing the damage caused by a tornado in Selma.
ALDOT collected over 18,000 images and processed the data in just 24 hours using the software.
The software enabled ALDOT to quickly process and distribute digital models and orthomosaics to different groups involved in the assessment process.

title: ANRA achieves regulatory milestone for drone operations in the UK
originSummary: ANRA Technologies is now a partner in the UK project called BLUEPRINT, which has been selected to participate in the UK Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) Temporary Reserved Area Regulatory Sandbox.
The project aims to test integrated BVLOS (Beyond Visual Line of Sight) drone operations in UK airspace and develop a blueprint for the rollout of such operations in the country.

ANRA's focus in the project is on effective air traffic management, UAS traffic management, and digital communication systems, with the goal of enabling the coexistence of drones and crewed aircraft in a safe and efficient operating environment.
